name: Double-Barreled
text: During this vehicle’s Attack Step, up to three weapons with the Crew Fired special rule may gain a +1 bonus to hit.

name: Boarding Party
text: This vehicle ignores the Distracted rule, meaning this vehicle may attack during the Attack Step even if the vehicle is touching an obstacle.

name: Battlehammer
text: When making a Smash Attack, this vehicle gains +1 attack die for each Hazard Token it currently has.

name: Terrifying Lunatic
text: Whenever a vehicle controlled by another player ends its Movement Step within Short range of this vehicle, the active vehicle gains a Hazard Token.

name: Grinderman
text: Before this vehicle rolls its attack dice in a Smash Attack, it may choose to add 1 Hazard Token to the target vehicle for each point of damage it inflicts, instead of removing Hull Points.

name: Murder Tractor
text: This vehicle may make piledriver attacks, like a War Rig.

name: Powder Keg
text: This vehicle may add 1 to its explosion check. Treat this vehicle as one weight-class heavier when it explodes. This bonus does apply during resolution of the Fireworks perk.

name: Crowd Pleaser
text: If this vehicle wipes out, gain 1 Audience Vote.

name: Road Warrior
text: Once per activation, if this vehicle has successfully caused one or more hits on an enemy vehicle at any point during this activation, this vehicle may remove a single Hazard Token at the end of its Attack Step.

name: Cover Me
text: Once during its activation, this vehicle may remove a Hazard Token and place it on another friendly vehicle within Double range.

name: Madman
text: At the end of this vehicle’s Movement Step, if it has 4 or more Hazard Tokens, it may remove a Hazard Token and place it on another vehicle within Medium range.

name: Bullet-Time
text: If this vehicle resolves a Slide result during its Movement Step, it may select one of its weapons to count as Turret-mounted for the rest of the activation.

name: Dead Weight
text: During this vehicle’s Attack Step, this vehicle may gain 2 Hazard Tokens to count as one weight-class heavier (unless already Heavyweight) until the start of its next activation.

name: Barrel Roll
text: When this vehicle suffers a Flip, it may choose to place the Flip template touching the centre of either side edge or the rear edge of this vehicle, and perpendicular to that edge, instead of touching the front edge as normal.

name: Bruiser
text: In a Collision involving this vehicle, if this vehicle declares a reaction other than Evade against an enemy vehicle, the enemy vehicle immediately gains one Hazard Token.

name: Splashback
text: Once per step, when this vehicle loses one or more Hull Points, make a 1D6 attack against each vehicle within Medium range at the end of that step.

name: Crusher
text: This vehicle gains the Up and Over special rule (see the Monster Truck rules).

name: Feel No Pain
text: During an enemy vehicle’s Attack Step, after an attacker has rolled all their attack dice against this vehicle, if the attacks caused a total of 2 or fewer uncancelled hits, cancel all remaining hits.

name: Chrome-Whisperer
text: This vehicle may Push It any number of times during a single Movement Step, gaining 1 Hazard Token each time.

name: Slippery
text: Vehicles making a Smash Attack targeting this vehicle suffer a penalty of -2 attack dice.

name: Handbrake Artist
text: When applying a Spin result, this vehicle may choose to face any direction.

name: Evasive
text: Before making an Evade roll, this vehicle may gain any number of Hazard Tokens to add +1 to each of its Evade dice for each Hazard Token gained. A roll of “1” on an Evade die always counts as a failure.

name: Powerslide
text: This vehicle may use any template except the long straight template instead of the slide template when applying a Slide result. (As in step 1.1 of the Movement Step, you must use the first movement template you touch. Treat the selected movement template as a slide template for purposes of finding the vehicle’s Final Position.

name: Stunt Driver
text: This perk may only be taken on a lightweight or middleweight vehicle type with a base Handling Value of 3 or more. This vehicle may choose to ignore any number of obstructions during its Movement Step. After any Movement Step in which this vehicle chose to ignore any obstruction using this ability, this vehicle immediately gains 3 Hazard Tokens.

name: Purifying Flames
text: Once per activation, at the start of this vehicle’s activation, this vehicle may suffer up to three damage to select any friendly vehicle. For each point of damage suffered via this effect, repair that number of Hull Points on the target vehicle. This damage may not be reduced and counts as having the Fire rule. This effect may not raise the target above its starting Hull value.

name: Ecstatic Visions
text: Once per activation, at the start of this vehicle’s activation, this vehicle may gain up to 3 Hazard Tokens to discard 1 Hazard Token from a friendly vehicle for each Hazard Token gained.

name: Sympathy for the Devil
text: When this vehicle makes an Evade check, its controller may select a friendly vehicle within Medium range. Add the current Gear of the selected vehicle to this vehicle’s current Gear for this Evade check. Both the selected vehicle and this vehicle suffer any unsaved damage from the attack, including additional effects.

name: Highway to Hell
text: At the end of its Movement Step, if this vehicle selected a straight template, it may suffer 2 damage. This damage counts as having the Fire rule. If any Hull Points are removed by this effect, leave this vehicle’s movement template (ignoring any slide template) in play as a Napalm dropped-weapon template until the start of this vehicle’s next activation.

name: Violent Manifestation
text: When this vehicle is respawned, make an immediate attack (with attack dice based on the weight of the respawned vehicle) against every other vehicle within Medium range as if this vehicle were an exploding wreck. This explosion has both the Blast and Fire rules.

name: Angel of Death
text: Before making an attack, this vehicle may suffer up to three damage to add that many attack dice to a single weapon used in that attack.

name: Dead-Eye
text: During this vehicle’s Attack Step, this vehicle gains a +1 bonus to hit when making a shooting attack at a target within Double range and not within Medium range. Critical Hits still occur only on the natural roll of a 6.

name: Loader
text: At the start of its Attack Step, this vehicle may temporarily reduce its Crew value by 1 (once, until the end of the Attack Step) to gain a +1 bonus to hit with a single weapon. Critical Hits still occur only on the natural roll of a 6.

name: Fully Loaded
text: If a shooting weapon on this vehicle has 3 or more Ammo Tokens remaining before discarding one to attack, that weapon gains +1 attack die.

name: Rapid Fire
text: Once per round, after attacking with a weapon, this vehicle may immediately resolve an additional Attack Step in which it may only attack with that same weapon.

name: Headshot
text: When making a shooting attack, this vehicle’s Critical Hits inflict 3 hits instead of the normal 2 hits.

name: Return Fire
text: Once per Gear Phase, if this vehicle is the target of a shooting attack, this vehicle may take 2 Hazzard Tokens to immediately attack, as if it was this vehicle's Attack Step

name: Mister Fahrenheit
text: This vehicle cannot gain more than 2 Hazard Tokens from Collisions during a single activation.

name: Moment of Glory
text: Once per game, after rolling the Skid Dice but before resolving the results, this vehicle may immediately change any number of Skid Dice to any results it chooses.

name: Restraint
text: When this vehicle would gain a Hazard Token for shifting down a Gear, it may remove one Hazard Token instead.

name: Expertise
text: This vehicle adds 1 to its Handling value.

name: Trick Driving
text: This vehicle may select a movement template as if its current Gear were one higher or one lower.

name: Easy Rider
text: Once per round, this vehicle may discard one rolled Skid Dice result before applying the results.

name: On Your Tail
text: When an enemy vehicle resolves a Spin or Slide move that ends within Short range of this vehicle, that enemy vehicle gains 1 Hazard Token.

name: Schadenfreude
text: If another vehicle wipes out within Short range of this vehicle (either before or after any Flip), remove all Hazard Tokens from this vehicle.

name: Taunt
text: At the start of this vehicle’s Attack Step, roll a Skid Die. If the result is not a Shift, you may place that Skid Die result onto the dashboard of a target vehicle within Short range. That result must be resolved during that vehicle’s next Movement Step and may not be re-rolled.

name: Out Run
text: At the start of this vehicle’s Attack Step, all vehicles within Short range of this vehicle and in a lower current Gear than this vehicle gain 1 Hazard Token.

name: PIT
text: During this vehicle’s activation, if it is involved in a non-head-on Collision with an enemy vehicle, it may declare a Pursuit Intervention Technique (PIT) as its reaction instead of a Smash Attack or Evade. If it does, select any movement template the target considers Hazardous in its current Gear. Immediately after the Collision is resolved, the target must make a forced move directly forward using the selected template.

name: Unnerving Eye Contact
text: Enemy vehicles within Short range of this vehicle may not use Shift results to remove Hazard Tokens from their dashboard.

name: Drive Angry
text: At the start of this vehicle’s activation, this vehicle gains 1 Hazard Token.

name: Hog Wild
text: During a Collision resolved during a Wipeout Step, this vehicle gains +2 Smash Attack dice.

name: In for a Penny
text: If this vehicle has gained six or more Hazard Tokens during this activation, it may double the attack dice of any Smash Attack it makes for the remainder of this activation.

name: Don’t Come Knocking
text: At the start of this vehicle’s activation, it may gain 4 Hazard Tokens. If it does, this vehicle cannot gain or lose any Hazard Tokens by any means until the start of its next activation.

name: Bigger’n You
text: If this vehicle is involved in a Collision, double any Smash Attack bonuses or penalties resulting from weight differences during that Collision.

name: Beerserker
text: When this vehicle would suffer damage outside of its activation, reduce that damage by 1, to a minimum of 1.

name: Hot Start
text: Roll a D6 at the start of the game. This vehicle starts the game in that Gear. Reroll if this would put the current Gear of the vehicle above its max Gear.

name: Slipstream
text: If this vehicle is involved in a tailgate Collision during its activation, it may declare a Slipstream reaction. If it does, the other vehicle may not declare a reaction. This vehicle may then change up or down one Gear and gains a Hazard Token. Neither vehicle gains Hazard Tokens as a result of this Collision.

name: Overload
text: When resolving Skid Dice during the Movement Step, this vehicle may roll one additional Skid Die. If it does, it must either change up at least one Gear or gain a Hazard Token.

name: Downshift
text: At the end of a Movement Step in which this vehicle changed down one or more Gears, this vehicle may make a forced move Short Straight forward.

name: Time Extended!
text: At the end of a Movement Step in which this vehicle passes a race gate, this vehicle may remove any number of Hazard Tokens.

name: Hell for Leather
text: This vehicle considers the Long Straight template to be permitted in any Gear. The Long Straight is not considered either Hazardous or Trivial in any Gear.

name: Rocket Thrusters
text: When this vehicle is moved as part of a Flip, it may choose to use the Long Straight, Veer, or Gentle templates instead of the Medium Straight template.

name: Whizbang
text: At the start of each game, this vehicle gains a random Speed perk. This perk is lost at the end of the game.

name: Gyroscope
text: At the start of each game, this vehicle gains a random Daring perk. This perk is lost at the end of the game.

name: Satellite Navigation
text: When this vehicle resolves its Skid Dice, its controller may set aside one Shift result. This vehicle may have any number of Shift results set aside. Any vehicle on this team may use these set-aside Shift results during a later Movement Step as if they had rolled them in that Movement Step.

name: Mobile Mechanic
text: Once per activation, at the start of its Attack Step, this vehicle may temporarily reduce its Crew value by 1 until the end of the Attack Step to perform a field repair. If it does, this vehicle gains 1 Hull Point, which may not raise its Hull Points above the vehicle’s starting Hull value.

name: Eureka!
text: Once per game, at the start of its Attack Step, this vehicle’s controller may declare any weapon that this vehicle has not attacked with yet this game. This vehicle counts as being armed with the declared weapon, on a facing of their choice, for that attack only.

name: Fenderkiss
text: When this vehicle makes a Smash Attack, it suffers a penalty of –2 attack dice. Vehicles making a Smash Attack targeting this vehicle also suffer a penalty of –2 attack dice.

name: Rear Drive
text: This vehicle may pivot about the centre of its front edge, rather than the centre of the vehicle, when resolving Spin results.

name: Delicate Touch
text: This vehicle ignores the hazard icons on movement templates.

name: Momentum
text: When resolving Skid Dice, this vehicle may set aside a Slide or Spin result to reroll a Skid Die. This effect may be used multiple times. Skid Dice that are set aside must still be resolved.

name: Purring
text: This vehicle does not gain more than 1 Hazard Token from Spin results each activation, more than 1 from Slide results each activation, or more than 1 from Hazard results each activation.

name: Skiing
text: If this vehicle has Handling 3 or higher, it may take 3 Hazard Tokens at the end of its Movement Step to be ignored by other vehicles during their Movement Steps until the start of this vehicle’s next activation. If, by ignoring this vehicle, another vehicle’s Final Position would overlap it, move that vehicle backwards along its movement template by the minimum amount required to avoid overlapping any obstruction.
